title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.17 | 09-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवास अधी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 17th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Sautye Vratakumatinatmada Ishwarome
Yadpada Padmam Abhavaya Bhajantibhavya
Maam Shrantavaham Arayo Rathino Bhuvishtham
Napraharan Yad Anubhava Nirastam
Yadpada Padmam Abhavaya Bhajantibhavya
The meaning of this verse is
It was by his mercy only that my enemies neglected to kill me when I descended from my chariot to get water for my thirsty horses.
And it was due to my lack of esteem for my lord that I dared engage him as my chariot driver
for he is worshipped
and offered services by the best men to attain salvation.
So Arjuna is recollecting some past incidents
in his intimate relationship with the Supreme Lord Krishna.
And it is clearly established that Krishna
is very, very merciful to his devotees,
especially his pure devotees.
He is very, very kind, very merciful,
and he is ready to do anything for his devotees.
So this is a good point that is being brought out by Arjuna
that Krishna, who is worshipped and offered services by the best of men to attain salvation,
is a very, very merciful person.
That Supreme Lord, Arjuna is thinking,
I dared engage him as my chariot driver.
So Srila Prabhupada explains this in the purport,
a little elaborately,
this point.
The Supreme Lord, the personality of God is Sri Krishna,
is the object of worship,
both by impersonalists,
by the devotees of the Lord the impersonalists worship his glowing effulgence emanating from his
transcendental body of eternal form bliss and knowledge so there are two categories of
transcendentalists who are followers of the Vedanta philosophy presented by Vyasa Deva the

impersonal Brahman this impersonal Brahman is a glowing effulgence coming out of the
transcendental form of Krishna

I am the seed giving father for all the living entities who take birth in this
material world at the beginning of creation all living beings belong to me
they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine they are mine
they are within me they are in me they are my own part and parcel eternally
they are my parts they belong to me so Krishna does not disown anybody though

our life even in this material world Bhagavad Gita elaborately explains this
how Krishna is prominent in our ordinary life even in this material world as
Paramatma has entered our heart and then he is conducting all the affairs of this
body we are totally helpless in this body
because we are spirit and this body is a made up of the material energy so for
us material energy is foreign a foreign substance so we do not know what is

utilize this body but Krishna facilitates us Paramatma so he is

descends comes down to this material world that's what we say he incarnates
to attract all by his specific transcendental pastimes and thus he
plays the part of the most perfect master
friend son and lover these are the personal relationships Krishna has with
his personal devotees perfect master he plays the part of the master when the
devotee wants to serve him as a servant when the devotee wants to serve him as
his friend then he acts as a perfect friend when the devotee wants to act as

wants him as
her beloved then he plays the part of the perfect lover
his transcendental relationship Arjuna was in friendship and a lot therefore
played the part perfectly as he did with his parents lovers and wives while
playing in such a perfect transcendental relation that devotee forgets by the
internal potency of the Lord
That is friend or son is a supreme personality of God.
Arjuna is repenting that how dare I engaged him as my chariot driver.
He is a supreme lord.
But the fact is Arjuna is made to forget that Krishna is the supreme lord by Krishna's internal potency, yoga maya.
So that it can facilitate the intimate pastimes in Krishna's relationship with his devotees.
Now Srila Prabhupada says Krishna wants to play the perfect part as the son or the friend or the lover.
And sometimes even though the yoga maya practice is not perfect,
the yoga maya covers the fact that Krishna is a supreme lord in his dealings with his devotees.
Sometimes the devotee is bewildered by the acts of the lord.
So after the departure of the lord, Arjuna was conscious of his great friend.
But there is no mistake on the part of Arjuna.
We should not think Arjuna made a big mistake by engaging Krishna as his chariot driver.
Nor any.
Arjuna was not wrongly thinking that Krishna is my friend.
No.
Intelligent men are attracted by the transcendental acting of the lord with a pure, unalloyed devotee like Arjuna.
So it requires intelligence to understand Krishna's dealings with his pure devotees.
Others who are conversant with the pure devotional,
only they can appreciate Krishna's kindness and magnanimity and love for his devotees.
Only on a pure devotional platform, we can understand these dealings of Krishna.
Otherwise, we may mistake either that Krishna is an ordinary person or we may wrongly think that devotees are too puffed up.
And proud to engage Krishna as their friend or as their son or as their lover.
No.
There is no mistake on the part of the devotees.
Neither Krishna is an ordinary person.
He retains.
He is eternally the transcendental supreme personality of Godhead.
But he, out of his own sweet will, he wants his devotees to serve him.
In an intimate way, as his son or, sorry, as his mother or father or lover or friend.
Krishna wants that.
And therefore, the devotees are never at fault.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
